Another longtime restaurant closes its doors in Munroe Falls News Sports Entertainment Lifestyle Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals STOW SENTRY Another longtime restaurant closes its doors in Munroe Falls Staff Writer Kent Weeklies by Mariana Silva | Reporter Munroe Falls -- A sign directing customers to the Crooked River Grill is gone and a lease sign is up on the lawn at 403 N. Main St. in Munroe Falls. The restaurant, which recently served as a location for the Board of Education community engagement meetings, is now closed, said Dave Waskowski, husband of the owner, Susanne Waskowski. She was out of town and not available to comment. "We decided it was time to close and that's it," Waskowski said. Waskowski said the restaurant has been officially closed for about three weeks. He said he would not comment whether the Crooked River Grill would open at another location. The building's owner, Frank Mastroine of Munroe Falls, said the restaurant's keys were turned in on Nov. 15 and that five people have inquired about leasing the location. Mastroine said Susanne Waskowski had been leasing the location for Crooked River Grill for 11 years. "It is a shame [that the restaurant] closed," said Mike Barnes of Munroe Falls, owner of Professional Technical Sales Associate Inc. and co-chair for the 2011 levy committee for Stow-Munroe Falls City Schools District. "They were always a big help for local activities and a good place for good food. "[They] were very supportive of the school-related events and clubs. They were a big contributor not only with time but with resources, too," Barnes said. "Obviously we are disappointed to see [Crooked River Grill] close but business is tough nowadays," Mayor Frank Larson said. "I was surprised because you go by [the restaurant] and it seemed like it was crowded every night. They served the best ribs I've ever had," Larson said. "And I'm sorry to see it go." Crooked River Grill | Carrabelle, Florida Dining Mobile Menu Toggle Home Menus Private Events Gallery Contact Us RESERVE <-  TAKE ME BACK TO THE HOTEL SITE Mobile Menu Toggle Home Menus Private Events Gallery Contact Us RESERVE Mobile Menu Toggle Home Menus Private Events Gallery Contact Us RESERVE Unexpected Flavors Unexpected Flavors Unexpected Flavors Crooked River Grill Carrabelle, FL Forgotten Coast Delights Take winding roads past lush maritime forests and scenic marshes to the Crooked River Grill. The menu here is marked by sophisticated takes on everything from locally caught shrimp and succulent steaks to bold cocktails made with the most generous pour on the Forgotten Coast — two ounces of premier liquor. With its direct views of our Audubon Signature golf course, this is the kind of dining experience best enjoyed with good friends. VIEW MENUS Hours of Operation Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM Sunday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CROOKED RIVER HIGHLIGHTS Spirited Selections From the impressive display wall of top-shelf spirits to our extensive bourbon collection, our bar serves up an experience worth savoring. Come try the Cocktail of the Month and enjoy a wide selection of wines, beers, and mixed drinks — all made with two ounces of liquor. LEARN MORE PRIVATE EVENTS Gather With Intention Whether you’re hosting your son’s wedding, celebrating your daughter’s graduation party, or closing out a pickleball tournament with a grand dinner, Crooked River Grill has flexible indoor and scenic outdoor spaces ideally suited for any kind of gathering. Pair that with a flavorful catering menu and an extensive wine list for an event that will linger in your guests’ memories. START PLANNING Tasty Tidbits Love this place and their staff I’m usually in town every other weekend with family and friends and this place is my favorite place to dine. The staff is always on point and friendly and the food never disappoints….. Their bar also serves up the best margaritas I have ever had! tamie788 | TripAdvisor Great brunch! Very relaxed atmosphere! Great service and a good selection for brunch food. We ate here several times and fully intend to be back. retiredexteacher | TripAdvisor Pleasant and yummy! On the St. James Country Club property. Very reasonable lunches and a great Chef. Salads, sandwiches, specials. Always fresh and delicious. Impress your guests at a restaurant that offers a unique and memorable venue for any special occasion. Weddings Add a touch of sweetness to your wedding day by having your ceremony under the shade of a mature oak and then spice things up with a reception at our beer garden. Meetings From finding the ideal venue and ordering just the right dishes to organizing fun activities for your group, a well-planned meeting commands attention and leaves a lasting impression. a few people drinking wine Special Occasions Come together to celebrate your most important moments at a place designed for good times. Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Welcome to James Bay Inn | Historic Hotel in Victoria, BC Home Rooms Our History Dine Blog Contact Book Now 800-836-2649 BOOK NOW Welcome to the Historical James Bay Inn Hotel, Suites & Cottage A landmark of Edwardian Architecture Helping you relax since 1911 Slide title Quaint & Cozy with Lush Grounds Button A Landmark of Edwardian Architecture Your Home Away from Home Book Now Located in the flower capital of Vancouver Island, Victoria, B.C and nestled in the heart of the exquisite district of James Bay. Quaint, Quiet, Cozy and Affordable. Lush, Environmentally friendly with a Green Key Global Eco rating of 3. Fresh air flowing  from the north via the Inner Harbour and from the south via the southern coast. Bicycle friendly with video monitored street bike lockup for residents/guests and secure indoor bike storage for guests. No air conditioning & no elevators. Access to a sunny verandah on floor 2 & 3.. Art Deco Cafe & Restaurant and a friendly pub on site. All guests are required to have a credit card upon arrival for incidentals. Cancellations less than 48 hours in advance will be charged no less than one night's stay. Please Note: No smoking and no pets are permitted. Hairdryers, iron & board and other conveniences are available at our friendly front desk. Need something? Please ask! You are at home with the James Bay Inn Hotel. Warning : Frequent tweeting from birds & hypnotic sounds of horse drawn carriages trotting by. We are a short pleasant leisurely walk to the Ocean, Beacon Hill Park, The Inner Harbour, Fisherman's Wharf & Downtown Victoria B.C. HOTEL ROOMS Hotel Rooms STUDIO & SUITES Button PRIVATE COTTAGE Button Book Direct: Special ABOUT US DINE Button CONTACT Button Guest Reviews Perfect location and very clean! The front desk staff are super helpful and friendly. Parking is included. Breakfast diner downstairs was amazing. Would definitely stay here again! There is no elevator though, so make sure you can handle your luggage up the stairs. We were prepared for this :) Morgan - Tripadvisor Made wedding family accommodation a great success ...!!! family group of 4 couples last week for my daughters wedding , great little rooms , enjoyable pub , wonderful cafe , will stay again .....easy walk to sight see , and the Empress for the ceremony ,...thank -you all...!! Rick Stone Richard S Outstanding staff, great location. I loved staying at this hotel. It is conveniently located to walk to the parliament buildings, Beacon Hill Park and downtown area restaurants, stores and waterfront. My room was spacious with two comfortable queen beds. Barb N I would not stay anywhere else. This 100+ year old hotel has charm and character with antiques throughout the building. Great location too. The pub and cafe in the basement are a locals hangout, so what does that tell you? The food and service was the best! Thanks Rick, Roy and the Front desk manager (never got your name...) for your service. Bar Manager was great to talk to. I'll be back!! Alberta Traveller We decided on the JBI late morning wondering if Breakfast was still on. It was. Excellent choice and we enjoyed. Very good meals with excellent service. We like this place. Plenty of parking on site. The staff seem to enjoy one another and the local clientele is obvious. When an establishment has locals mix with tourists they have a winner. These folks have it nailed. Harold W JAMESBAYINN Button Button Button Button Button Button Button Button Button Button View more BOOK NOW CALL US FOLLOW BLOG Home Rooms Our History Dine Contact © 2025 James Bay Inn | All Rights Reserved BOOK A ROOM Privacy & Cookies Share by:
